BashStage.description:
Bash stage executor that execute bash script on the current OS.
If your current OS is Windows, it will run on the bash from the current WSL.
It will use `bash` for Windows OS and use `sh` for Linux OS.

    This stage has some limitation when it runs shell statement with the
built-in subprocess package. It does not good enough to use multiline
statement. Thus, it will write the `.sh` file before start running bash
command for fix this issue.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "The Shell stage execution",
    ...     "bash": 'echo "Hello $FOO"',
    ...     "env": {
    ...         "FOO": "BAR",
    ...     },
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.description: A stage ID that use to keep execution output or getting by job owner.
id.title: Id

name.description: A stage name that want to logging when start execution.
name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

bash.description: A bash statement that want to execute via Python subprocess.
bash.title: Bash

env.description: An environment variables that set before run bash command. It will add on the header of the `.sh` file.
env.title: Env

BashStage.title: BashStage

CallStage.description:
Call stage executor that call the Python function from registry with tag
decorator function in `reusables` module and run it with input arguments.

    This stage is different with PyStage because the PyStage is just run
a Python statement with the `exec` function and pass the current locals and
globals before exec that statement. This stage will import the caller
function can call it with an input arguments. So, you can create your
function complexly that you can for your objective to invoked by this stage
object.

    This stage is the most powerful stage of this package for run every
use-case by a custom requirement that you want by creating the Python
function and adding it to the caller registry value by importer syntax like
`module.caller.registry` not path style like `module/caller/registry`.

Warning:

    The caller registry to get a caller function should importable by the
current Python execution pointer.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Task stage execution",
    ...     "uses": "tasks/function-name@tag-name",
    ...     "args": {"arg01": "BAR", "kwarg01": 10},
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.description: A stage ID that use to keep execution output or getting by job owner.
id.title: Id

name.description: A stage name that want to logging when start execution.
name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

uses.description: A caller function with registry importer syntax that use to load function before execute step. The caller registry syntax should be `<import.part>/<func-name>@<tag-name>`.
uses.title: Uses

with.description: An argument parameter that will pass to this caller function.
with.title: With

CallStage.title: CallStage

CaseStage.description:
Case stage executor that execute all stages if the condition was matched.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "If stage execution.",
    ...     "case": "${{ param.test }}",
    ...     "match": [
    ...         {
    ...             "case": "1",
    ...             "stages": [
    ...                 {
    ...                     "name": "Stage case 1",
    ...                     "eche": "Hello case 1",
    ...                 },
    ...             ],
    ...         },
    ...         {
    ...             "case": "_",
    ...             "stages": [
    ...                 {
    ...                     "name": "Stage else",
    ...                     "eche": "Hello case else",
    ...                 },
    ...             ],
    ...         },
    ...     ],
    ... }

desc.title: Desc

if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

match.description: A list of Match model that should not be an empty list.
match.title: Match

skip-not-match.description: A flag for making skip if it does not match and else condition does not set too.
skip-not-match.title: Skip-Not-Match

DockerStage.description:
Docker container stage execution that will pull the specific Docker image
with custom authentication and run this image by passing environment
variables and mounting local volume to this Docker container.

    The volume path that mount to this Docker container will limit. That is
this stage does not allow you to mount any path to this container.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Docker stage execution",
    ...     "image": "image-name.pkg.com",
    ...     "env": {
    ...         "ENV": "dev",
    ...         "SECRET": "${SPECIFIC_SECRET}",
    ...     },
    ...     "auth": {
    ...         "username": "__json_key",
    ...         "password": "${GOOGLE_CREDENTIAL_JSON_STRING}",
    ...     },
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.description: A stage ID that use to keep execution output or getting by job owner.
id.title: Id

name.description: A stage name that want to logging when start execution.
name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

image.description: A Docker image url with tag that want to run.
image.title: Image

env.description: An environment variable that want pass to Docker container.
env.title: Env

volume.description: A mapping of local and target mounting path.
volume.title: Volume

auth.description: An authentication of the Docker registry that use in pulling step.
auth.title: Auth

DockerStage.title: DockerStage

EmptyStage.description:
Empty stage executor that do nothing and log the `message` field to
stdout only. It can use for tracking a template parameter on the workflow or
debug step.

    You can pass a sleep value in second unit to this stage for waiting
after log message.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Empty stage execution",
    ...     "echo": "Hello World",
    ...     "sleep": 1,
    ... }

desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

echo.description: A message that want to show on the stdout.
echo.title: Echo

sleep.description: A second value to sleep before start execution. This value should gather or equal 0, and less than 1800 seconds.
sleep.title: Sleep

ForEachStage.description:
For-Each stage executor that execute all stages with each item in the
foreach list.

    This stage is not the low-level stage model because it runs
multi-stages in this stage execution.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "For-each stage execution",
    ...     "foreach": [1, 2, 3]
    ...     "stages": [
    ...         {
    ...             "name": "Echo stage",
    ...             "echo": "Start run with item ${{ item }}"
    ...         },
    ...     ],
    ... }

Job.description:
Job Pydantic model object (short descripte: a group of stages).

    This job model allow you to use for-loop that call matrix strategy. If
you pass matrix mapping, and it is able to generate, you will see it running
with loop of matrix values.

Data Validate:
    >>> job = {
    ...     "runs-on": {"type": "local"},
    ...     "strategy": {
    ...         "max-parallel": 1,
    ...         "matrix": {
    ...             "first": [1, 2, 3],
    ...             "second": ['foo', 'bar'],
    ...         },
    ...     },
    ...     "needs": [],
    ...     "stages": [
    ...         {
    ...             "name": "Some stage",
    ...             "run": "print('Hello World')",
    ...         },
    ...     ],
    ... }

id.description: A job ID that was set from Workflow model after initialize step. If this model create standalone, it will be None.
id.title: Id

desc.description: A job description that can be markdown syntax.
desc.title: Desc

runs-on.description: A target node for this job to use for execution.
runs-on.title: Runs-On

if.description: A job condition statement to allow job executable.
if.title: If

stages.description: A list of Stage model of this job.

items.description: A stage models that already implemented on this package.

stages.title: Stages

trigger-rule.description: A trigger rule of tracking needed jobs if feature will use when the `raise_error` did not set from job and stage executions.

needs.description: A list of the job that want to run before this job model.
needs.title: Needs

strategy.description: A strategy matrix that want to generate.

ParallelStage.description:
Parallel stage executor that execute branch stages with multithreading.
This stage let you set the fix branches for running child stage inside it on
multithread pool.

    This stage is not the low-level stage model because it runs multi-stages
in this stage execution.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Parallel stage execution.",
    ...     "parallel": {
    ...         "branch01": [
    ...             {
    ...                 "name": "Echo first stage",
    ...                 "echo": "Start run with branch 1",
    ...                 "sleep": 3,
    ...             },
    ...             {
    ...                 "name": "Echo second stage",
    ...                 "echo": "Start run with branch 1",
    ...             },
    ...         ],
    ...         "branch02": [
    ...             {
    ...                 "name": "Echo first stage",
    ...                 "echo": "Start run with branch 2",
    ...                 "sleep": 1,
    ...             },
    ...         ],
    ...     }
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.description: A stage ID that use to keep execution output or getting by job owner.
id.title: Id

name.description: A stage name that want to logging when start execution.
name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

items.description: A stage models that already implemented on this package.

parallel.description: A mapping of branch name and its stages.
parallel.title: Parallel

max-workers.description: The maximum multi-thread pool worker size for execution parallel. This value should be gather or equal than 1, and less than 20.
max-workers.title: Max-Workers

ParallelStage.title: ParallelStage

PyStage.description:
Python stage that running the Python statement with the current globals
and passing an input additional variables via `exec` built-in function.

    This stage allow you to use any Python object that exists on the globals
such as import your installed package.

Warning:

    The exec build-in function is very dangerous. So, it should use the `re`
module to validate exec-string before running or exclude the `os` package
from the current globals variable.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Python stage execution",
    ...     "run": 'print(f"Hello {VARIABLE}")',
    ...     "vars": {
    ...         "VARIABLE": "WORLD",
    ...     },
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.description: A stage ID that use to keep execution output or getting by job owner.
id.title: Id

name.description: A stage name that want to logging when start execution.
name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

run.description: A Python string statement that want to run with `exec`.
run.title: Run

vars.description: A variable mapping that want to pass to globals parameter in the `exec` func.
vars.title: Vars

PyStage.title: PyStage

Strategy.description:
Strategy model that will combine a matrix together for running the
special job with combination of matrix data.

    This model does not be the part of job only because you can use it to
any model object. The objective of this model is generating metrix result
that comming from combination logic with any matrix values for running it
with parallelism.

    [1, 2, 3] x [a, b] --> [1a], [1b], [2a], [2b], [3a], [3b]

Data Validate:
    >>> strategy = {
    ...     'max-parallel': 1,
    ...     'fail-fast': False,
    ...     'matrix': {
    ...         'first': [1, 2, 3],
    ...         'second': ['foo', 'bar'],
    ...     },
    ...     'include': [{'first': 4, 'second': 'foo'}],
    ...     'exclude': [{'first': 1, 'second': 'bar'}],
    ... }

fail-fast.description: A fail-fast flag that use to cancel strategy execution when it has some execution was failed.
fail-fast.title: Fail-Fast

max-parallel.description: The maximum number of executor thread pool that want to run parallel. This value should gather than 0 and less than 10.
max-parallel.title: Max-Parallel

matrix.description: A matrix values that want to cross product to possible strategies.
matrix.title: Matrix

include.description: A list of additional matrix that want to adds-in.
include.title: Include

exclude.description: A list of exclude matrix that want to filter-out.
exclude.title: Exclude

Strategy.title: Strategy

TriggerStage.description:
Trigger workflow executor stage that run an input trigger Workflow
execute method. This is the stage that allow you to create the reusable
Workflow template with dynamic parameters.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Trigger workflow stage execution",
    ...     "trigger": 'workflow-name-for-loader',
    ...     "params": {"run-date": "2024-08-01", "source": "src"},
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

id.title: Id

name.title: Name

desc.description: A stage description that use to logging when start execution.
desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

trigger.description: A trigger workflow name. This workflow name should exist on the config path because it will load by the `load_conf` method.
trigger.title: Trigger

params.description: A parameter that will pass to workflow execution method.
params.title: Params

TriggerStage.title: TriggerStage

UntilStage.description:
Until stage executor that will run stages in each loop until it valid
with stop loop condition.

    This stage is not the low-level stage model because it runs
multi-stages in this stage execution.

Data Validate:
    >>> stage = {
    ...     "name": "Until stage execution",
    ...     "item": 1,
    ...     "until": "${{ item }} > 3"
    ...     "stages": [
    ...         {
    ...             "name": "Start increase item value.",
    ...             "run": (
    ...                 "item = ${{ item }}\n"
    ...                 "item += 1\n"
    ...             )
    ...         },
    ...     ],
    ... }

extras.description: An extra parameter that override core config values.
extras.title: Extras

name.title: Name

desc.title: Desc

if.description: A stage condition statement to allow stage executable. This field alise with `if` field.
if.title: If

retry.description: A retry number if stage execution get the error.
retry.title: Retry

item.description: An initial value that can be any value in str, int, or bool type.
item.title: Item

until.description: A until condition for stop the while loop.
until.title: Until

stages.description: A list of stage that will run with each item in until loop.

items.description: A stage models that already implemented on this package.

stages.title: Stages

max-loop.description: The maximum value of loop for this until stage. This value should be gather or equal than 1, and less than 100.
max-loop.title: Max-Loop
